chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Scott Clyburn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$585.00 payable to Great Clips located at 10280 W. National Ave; $753.87 payable to Matthew P.; $1,985.96 to Progressive Universal Insurance Co.; $3,668.79 payable to Walgreens located at 9100 W. Beloit Ave.
To be paid before Court ordered costs with Matthew P. being paid first.

Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
*As to all counts, pay victim witness surcharge and all other mandatory applicable fees, assessments and costs.
All financial obligations and restitution to be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remainnig due and owing is subject to civil judgment

Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving the first three years of this sentence.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts two, three and five, consecutive to other time that may be served.  Credit for 134 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.

Obtain mental health assessment if not previously done so.  Successfully complete follow up treatment and programming. Take any and all precription medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physician.

No drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users/dealers or drug houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victims Matthew P., Laura N., Timothy G., Habtermarian T., Charles G. and Great Clips located at 10280 W. National Ave; as to Charles G. only, agent given discretion to lift no contact order as it was not requested by victim.

Pay all supervision fees.
Cooperate with any and all rules set foth by the probation agent.
Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow up treatment.  Cooperate with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, three and five, consecutive to any other time that may be served.  Credit for 134 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, two and five.  Credit for 134 days.  Consecutive to any other  time that may be served.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, tow and three; consecutive to other time that may be served. Credit for 134 days.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (60 pages) commencing JULY 9, 2014 received and filed.
Defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Robert Scott Clyburn in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Defendant Robert Scott Clyburn in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

On motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 amended to DRIVE OR OPERATE WITHOUT CONSENT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.23 (3m), a Class A Misdemeanor.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, AND 5:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  

AS TO COUNT 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, the Court ordered Count 4 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing.

The Court ordered the defendant REMANDED at this time.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Robert Scott Clyburn not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Scott Clyburn in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Robert Scott Clyburn in custody.  Karl Hayes for Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:  WALGREENS, GREAT CLIPS, Hablemarian T., Timothy G., Matthew P., Laura N. and Charles G.

Defendant Robert Scott Clyburn in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Robert Scott Clyburn in custody.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
